quests.desc: It's time to explore the amazing world of TextWorld! First step, open the hatch. Then, attempt to go south. After that, try to travel west. With that accomplished, attempt to move south. And then, attempt to take a trip east. If you can succeed at that, pick-up the sandwich from the floor of the workshop. And if you do that, you're the winner!

infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You've just walked into a kitchen. You begin looking for stuff.



 There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] hatch leading north. There is an unguarded exit to the south. There is an unblocked exit to the west.

infos.name: sauna
infos.desc:
You are in a sauna. A typical one.



There is an unblocked exit to the east. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: workshop
infos.desc:
You've seen better workshops, but at least this one seems pretty normal.

 You see a bureau. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The bureau contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

infos.name: spare room
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a spare room. A normal kind of place. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call 'looking.'

 Oh, great. Here's a rack. The rack is standard.[if there is something on the s_0] On the rack you make out [a list of things on the s_0]. Classic TextWorld.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] However, the rack, like an empty rack, has nothing on it. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the rack.[end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: chamber
infos.desc:
You arrive in a chamber. A standard one.

 You can see a shelf. [if there is something on the s_1]On the shelf you can see [a list of things on the s_1].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]But there isn't a thing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading south. There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading west.

infos.name: steam room
infos.desc:
You arrive in a steam room. An ordinary kind of place. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call 'looking.'

 You smell a fine smell, and follow it to a cabinet. Huh, weird.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The cabinet contains [a list of things in the c_1]. Something scurries by right in the corner of your eye. Probably nothing.[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You make out a box.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The box contains [a list of things in the c_2]. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best?[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The box is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if]

 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading east. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading west.

infos.name: pantry
infos.desc:
You're now in a pantry.

 [if c_3 is locked]A locked[else if c_3 is open]An open[otherwise]A closed[end if] case is right there by you.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The case contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] What a letdown! The case is empty![end if] You can make out [if c_4 is locked]a locked[else if c_4 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] trunk in the corner.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The trunk contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] The trunk is empty, what a horrible day![end if] You see a gleam over in a corner, where you can see a stand. [if there is something on the s_2]On the stand you can see [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of garbage. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading east. There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading west.

infos.name: bathroom
infos.desc:
If you're wondering why everything seems so standard all of a sudden, it's because you've just walked into the bathroom. You decide to just list off a complete list of everything you see in the room, because hey, why not?



 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] portal leading east. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: study
infos.desc:
I just think it's great that you've just entered a study. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You see a chair. The chair is usual.[if there is something on the s_3] On the chair you make out [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] However, the chair, like an empty chair, has nothing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

 There is [if d_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] hatch leading south. There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading north.

infos.name: washroom
infos.desc:
You've entered a washroom. The room is well lit.

 You see a counter. [if there is something on the s_4]You see [a list of things on the s_4] on the counter. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this![end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though.[end if]

There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: hatch
infos.desc: The hatch looks robust. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: passageway
infos.desc: it's a manageable passageway [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: gateway
infos.desc: it's a hefty gateway [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: door
infos.desc: it is what it is, a door [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: portal
infos.desc: it is what it is, a portal [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: bureau
infos.desc: The bureau looks strong, and impossible to crack. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: cabinet
infos.desc: The cabinet looks strong, and impossible to crack. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: box
infos.desc: The box looks strong, and impossible to destroy. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: case
infos.desc: The case looks strong, and impossible to break. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: trunk
infos.desc: The trunk looks strong, and impossible to break. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: sandwich
infos.desc: that's a typical sandwich!

infos.name: keycard
infos.desc: The keycard is cold to the touch

infos.name: rack
infos.desc: The rack is an unstable piece of junk.

infos.name: shelf
infos.desc: The shelf is reliable.

infos.name: stand
infos.desc: The stand is shaky.

infos.name: chair
infos.desc: The chair is solidly built.

infos.name: counter
infos.desc: The counter is shaky.

objective: Welcome to TextWorld! Here is how to play! First step, make sure that the hatch is wide open. Once you have opened the hatch, try to move south. With that over with, travel west. Then, take a trip south. Then, go to the east. Once you succeed at that, lift the sandwich from the floor of the workshop. Alright, thanks!
